metadata.title: CVE-2021-22135 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: Elasticsearch versions before 7.11.2 and 6.8.15 contain a documentdisclosure flaw was found in the Elasticsearch suggester and profile APIwhen Document and Field Level Security are enabled. The suggester andprofile API are normally disabled for an index when document level securityis enabled on the index. Certain queries are able to enable the profilerand suggester which could lead to disclosing the existence of documents andfields the attacker should not be able to view.

criterions.comment: elasticsearch: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
